section.section: The Advisory Council consists of 24 members appointed by the Governor.
The number of names on a list shall be 3.
If a vacancy occurs for a reason other than expiration of the term, the Governor may appoint any individual without the list.
The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of 16 of the members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Advisory Council as of July 1, 1982.
The terms of eight of the members are staggered as required by the terms provided as of July 1, 2001.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who serves 2 consecutive full 4-year terms may not be reappointed for 4 years after the completion of those terms.
If a vacancy occurs, the Governor promptly shall appoint a successor.
